concept.title: Governance
concept.shortdesc: Governance is the set of processes, roles, policies, controls, and metrics that an organization develops and implements around information to manage its security and privacy.

conbody.p: Information governance is about controlling and protecting an organizationâ€™s data. The data may be sensitive, or perhaps it is important that the data be absolutely accurate, or perhaps the organization must achieve legislative and compliance targets. Data governance includes the process and policies around the protection, curation, and access to data and encompasses all of privacy protection, data security, lifecycle management, and data audit.

A governance policy is a coordinated approach to protecting data and assigning privileges to users. To control and protect your data, your organization should have a clearly defined policy governing data. The governance policy will drive how the PHEMI Administrator configured PHEMI Central.

p.xref: How do I define a governance policy?Make sure your organization's governance policy is defined before you begin configuration.
